manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Enjoy A Smoother Shave Whether you use a shaving brush, or prefer to apply directly to your face, build a rich, thick and creamy lather with our Sandalwood Shaving Cream.

Inspired by Nature Shaving shouldn't be complicated. It's why we include simple ingredients like coconut oil and real sandalwood essential oil so you can feel good about what you're putting on your skin.

Men's Grooming Inspired by Nature Apply with Brush or Hands Our sandalwood shaving cream is perfect for guys looking to up their shaving routine with a thick and creamy lather. You can use a shaving brush or apply directly to your face to quickly build a creamy and lush lather. Real Sandalwood Essential Oil Our shaving cream contains real sandalwood essential oil and other great ingredients like coconut oil and aloe. A Daily Indulgence Shaving is a great time to do some thinking and get some much needed alone time. Treat yourself with our sandalwood shaving cream by making it an addition to your daily shaving routine.

Crafted in Small Batches to Ensure Maximum Freshness And Quality We take product quality very seriously, which is why we create our shaving cream in small batches to ensure our products adhere to the highest level of quality. Our frequent production runs mean you receive a shaving cream that contains only the freshest ingredients.
Trusted & Used Daily by 200,000+ Men Rocky Mountain Barber products are trusted and used daily by professional and amateur athletes, outdoor adventurists and awesome people just like you!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A little goes a long way
reviews.reviewText: It takes a while to find the consistency you like, but it's worth it. I'm very picky when it comes to shaving creams, mostly because of the after smell. I like this one. It helps give a smooth shave.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent quality and shave
reviews.reviewText: For those who want a premium shaving cream that doesn’t cost $30, this is an excellent product. Unlike the competing products, this has a stickier consistency, which actually lifts up the facial hairs for a closer shave. You also don’t need too much product for each shave, which helps the product last longer. It has a really nice cooling scent and feel after the shave. I’ve bought other products from Rocky Mountain (shampoo, etc.) and they have all been excellent. Highly recommended.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Read the ingredients
reviews.reviewText: This shaving cream works very well, performs exactly as they said it would however, I didn't read the ingredients as well as I should have. After rereading the ingredients, I found menthol is in the mix, the problem is (in my opinion) there is too much menthol and when I was through shaving my face actually felt like it was burning and for quite a while. It was very unpleasant and uncomfortable. I'll be looking for something to replace it with and only use it if I have to.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I recently switched from The Art of Shaving (TAoS) shave cream to this.Pros:As good or better in all aspects. Especially price. The scent is nice, although not the Sandalwood scent that I am used to or have encountered before. It's not bad at all, it's just not 'sandalwood'.Cons:I prefer unscented shave cream so that any lingering/latent scent from shaving is not present post-shave, when I may choose to use a different scented after-shave lotion or cologne. I don't like having competing scents, neither does my wife.It would be great if there were an unscented version of this. I would definitely buy that. I will definitely buy this product again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wow, I love this Stuff. Simple ingredients, Wonderful Smell.
reviews.reviewText: I looked for a long time to find a shaving cream that wasn't loaded with ingredients that I didn't want all over my face.This one fit the bill, and it did not disappoint. I've used Proraso (which is very nice), and Art of Shaving (all Sandalwood), and for the price, smell, and feel, the Rocky Mountain wins out.Not to put down Proraso or Art of Shaving. Art of Shaving Sandalwood has an amazing smell, and I love their pre-shave, and after shave balms, but I wanted something with fewer, and simplier ingredients.The Rocky Mountain Barber Company (whew, that's a lot to type, let's go with RMBC), shaving cream is made with the following:Water, Stearic Acid, Cocos Nucifera (coconut oil), Glycerin, Potassium Hydroxide, Aloe Barbadensis, Sodium Hydroxide, Fragrance/parfum, Menthol, Sodium Borate, Glyceral Caprylate and Glycercal Undecylenate, Allantoin, Santalum Spicatum (sandalwood) oil.It's got real sandalwood oil in it (other creams will only list it as fragrance, but this has the real Santalum Spicatum in it), but the smell, probably from the coconut oil is somewhat sweet, and the addition of menthol makes it go on very cool. You almost don't need an after shave balm with this. Just rinse with cold water, and you'll really feel it. It's awesome.I will say that this is much more viscous than other creams. It goes on thick, and I find myself needing to really clean out my double edge razor. I think the trick is that a little goes a long way. There's no need to over-do the application.Since it is a little more viscus, I find I need to clean out my application brush a little better than with other creams.Small price to pay however for a shaving cream that is fantastic.The tin is high quality and could be used to store spent razors (if you use double edge) for later disposal.All in all. This is great stuff.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not Good, Not Bad, Not Ugly.
reviews.reviewText: So I'm looking for a new pre-shave, shave cream/soap, and after shave balm. My fall-back go to since 2010 has been the Art of Shaving Sandalwood. In the last couple of years they've changed up their formula, and it doesn't have the same long-lasting smell as it did before. What I'm looking for is a scent that people smell and comment on how great it smells, like they did when I first started using AoS products. This product didn't fill those hopes.This shave cream is mediocre.Pros:- It has the exact same scent profile as the oil and after-shave balm, so you don't have to worry about conflicting scents.- It made a pretty good lather. Others, as I've read, had trouble with this however I didn't. It needs a little moisture to get going, but was pretty good.- My favorite part about this was the added menthol umph! I didn't expect it, and I really welcomed the feeling.Cons:- The scent, like the rest of the line of products doesn't meet the AoS Sandalwood standard. This stuff has more of a barbasol scent, but added in a hint of sandalwood with a sweet smelling profile. Almost as if you combine barbasol and swisher sweets (small, sweet smelling cigars). It's not a bad smell, just not what I'm looking to be my go-to scent.- The scent wears off about halfway through the day. I want a scent that stays.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Provides a good thick lather
reviews.reviewText: I got into brush shaving a while back and was paying $$$$ too much for Art of Shaving versions of the oil and shave cream. Tried several other shave creams and soaps, besides AOS, including Lather & Wood and Van Der Hagan. AOS products usually provided richer lather, but were too pricey. This shave cream reminds me a lot of the AOS shave cream, but at a much more affordable price. Lather is rich and creamy off a brush. You don't need much. Maybe a dime size dollop. I put that on the lid and use the brush to work up a lather that I then apply to my face. There's usually enough cream to do one pass with the grain and then lather up again to go against the grain. The menthol is a nice soothing touch that I really enjoy. And the cream provides great glide for the razor. The remainder also rinses off cleanly. I'm definitely going back to this one again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My Husband loves this shaving product
reviews.reviewText: My Husband likes the old fashioned way of shaving. He has introduced it to his son and grandson, who also like the feel of their skin after a shave with the,

Used Proraso shaving cream with double sided safety razor for years, Amazon doesn't sell it anymore, tried this stuff. Needs a little more water, starts thick, a half twist of the brush in the tin then mixed in the bowl with a few drops of water builds a very nice lather, with enough for two full passes with the razor.

This is really good stuff. All quality shave creams are expensive these days, but with Rocky Mountain a little bit goes a long way, so it really lasts. It lathers nicely and has a light scent- maybe a little too light for me, I prefer the stronger scent in Taylor of Old Bond, but who can afford that stuff anymore?? This is a good substitute for a little better price
Manufacturer needs to install a plastic skin over the container to prevent leakage. Had to clean up the container upon arrival.
Love the quality of this cream, reduces razor burn
The shaving soap smells great and really reduces irradiation of the skin.
